intro: Kefersteinia tolimensis, commonly known as the Tolima kefersteinia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Colombia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish-white flowers. It is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous terrain. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
